meanings.sent1: The blue shirt looks better on you.
meanings.sent2: She thought the red dress looked better for the occasion.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the box looked better as a bed.
meanings.sent4: The sun made the sky look better than any painting.
meanings.sent5: The fresh flowers made the room look better instantly.

meanings.sent1: You can better your score with more practice.
meanings.sent2: He wanted to better his skills in playing the guitar.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to better his recipe by adding more spices.
meanings.sent4: She aimed to better her time in the next race.
meanings.sent5: The team worked hard to better their performance for the championship.

meanings.definition: To a greater degree or extent
meanings.sent1: She can better understand the topic after studying more.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept so the students could better grasp it.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to better solve the mystery with new clues.
meanings.sent4: The athlete pushed himself to better his previous record.
meanings.sent5: The scientist wanted to better explore the unknown depths of the ocean.
